alert.note: Alert for Iron (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 04 at 4:45AM CST until January 05 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 PM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches, except 8 to locally 18 inches for northern Iron county. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph may lead to near-blizzard conditions at times. * WHERE...Iron County. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 9 PM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
